docs.lead_paragraph: Coming off another season of critically acclaimed work, Playwrights Horizons on Thursday announced five of the six productions in its 2011-12 lineup, including a world premiere from Gina Gionfriddo (a Pulitzer Prize finalist for ''Becky Shaw''). The season will begin in August with Pam MacKinnon's production of ''Completeness,'' by Itamar Moses (''The Four of Us''), a comedy about a computer scientist who falls for a molecular biologist. Next will be ''Milk Like Sugar,'' a co-production with the Women's Project theater company about an inner-city teenager in a pregnancy pact, written by Kirsten Greenidge (''Bossa Nova'') and directed by Rebecca Taichman (''Orlando''). Ms. Gionfriddo's new play, ''Rapture, Blister, Burn,'' will follow, directed by Peter DuBois (''Becky Shaw''). According to a news release, the play is ''an unflinching look at gender politics in the wake of 20th-century feminist ideals,'' centering on two friends who pursued different careers and start dangerously coveting the other's life. Leslye Headland, whose play ''Bachelorette'' was an Off Broadway hit, will reunite with her director on that dark comedy, Trip Cullman, for her new satire, ''Assistance,'' about young assistants suffering humiliations working for a powerful magnate. And Sam Gold will direct ''The Big Meal,'' a love story that spans 80 years, written by Dan LeFranc (''Sixty Miles to Silver Lake'').

headline.main: ARTS, BRIEFLY: Playwrights Horizons Sets 2011-12 Season

docs.abstract: Playwrights Horizons announces five of the six productions for its 2011-12 lineup, including premiere of Gina Gionfriddo play Rapture, Blister, Burn. (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: Coming off another season of critically acclaimed work, the Off Broadway theater Playwrights Horizons on Thursday announced five of the six productions in its 2011-12 line-up, including a world premiere from Gina Gionfriddo (a Pulitzer Prize finalist for "Becky Shaw") and directing gigs for Sam Gold (who staged the theater's current hit "Kin") and Pam MacKinnon (director of its 2010 hit "Clybourne Park").

docs.lead_paragraph: Babies whose mothers took codeine, oxycodone and other opioid pain drugs early in pregnancy were more likely than others to have congenital problems, a federal study found.

headline.seo: Opioids May Play a Role in Congenital Problems
headline.main: Risks: Pain Drugs May Lead to Birth Defects
headline.print_headline: RISKS: Pain Drugs May Lead to Birth Defects
